de.esoco.ewt.component

Class Container

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.esoco.ewt.component.Component
      • de.esoco.ewt.component.Container
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    de.esoco.lib.property.HasId<java.lang.String>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Panel, View

    public abstract class Container
extends Component
    The base class for GEWT containers. It wraps an implementation of the GWT interface HasWidgets.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Container

        public Container()

    • Method Detail

      • clear

        public void clear()
        Removes all components from this container. Depending on the implementation this call may invalidate the components. To prevent errors no methods should be invoked on a component after it has been removed from it's container.

      • findChildByStyleName

        public Component findChildByStyleName(java.lang.String sStyle)
        Recursively searches a child component with a certain style name.
        Parameters:
        sStyle - The style name to search
        Returns:
        The first child with the given style name or NULL if none could be found in this container's hierarchy

      • getComponentIndex

        public int getComponentIndex(Component rComponent)
        Returns the index of a certain child component. This method will only work correctly for indexed containers for which the isIndexed() returns TRUE.
        Parameters:
        rComponent - The child component to return the index of
        Returns:
        The component's index or -1 if not found or not supported

      • getComponents

        public final java.util.List<Component> getComponents()
        Returns a list of the components of this container. The components are in the order in which they have been added to the container.
        Returns:
        The list of components

      • getLayout

        public GenericLayout getLayout()
        Returns the layout used by the container to arrange and size it's components.
        Returns:
        The layout of the container

      • getNewComponentPosition

        public int getNewComponentPosition()
        Returns the position at which new components will be added to this container.
        Returns:
        The position index for new components or -1 if new components are added as the last child of the container
        See Also:
        setNewComponentPosition(int)

      • internalAddComponent

        public final void internalAddComponent(Component rComponent,
                                       StyleData rStyleData)
        EWT-internal method to add a component to this container. Application code should never invoke this method but use a ContainerBuilder instance instead. The container builder will then invoke this method.
        Parameters:
        rComponent - The component to add
        rStyleData - The style data for the component

      • isIndexed

        public boolean isIndexed()
        Returns the indexed.
        Returns:
        The indexed

      • removeComponent

        public void removeComponent(Component rComponent)
        Removes a certain component from this container. Depending on the implementation this call may invalidate the component. To prevent errors no methods should be invoked on a component after it has been removed from it's container.
        Parameters:
        rComponent - The component to remove

      • setChildrenEnabled

        public void setChildrenEnabled(boolean bEnable)
        Sets the enabled state of all child components. This is done recursively, i.e. the method will be invoked on all child containers.
        Parameters:
        bEnable - The new enabled state

      • setLayout

        public void setLayout(GenericLayout rLayout)
        Sets the layout to be used by the container to arrange and size it's components.
        Parameters:
        rLayout - The layout to use

      • setNewComponentPosition

        public void setNewComponentPosition(int nPosition)
        Sets the position at which new components will be added to this container. Afterwards new components will be added before any other component at that index. This also implies that subsequently added components will be added before each other until the new component position is changed. This method will only work correctly for indexed containers for which the method isIndexed() returns TRUE.
        Parameters:
        nPosition - The position index for new components or -1 to add new components as the last child of the container

      • createWidget

        protected com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.IsWidget createWidget(StyleData rStyle)
        Overridden to let the layout create the container widget. A final check for a correct container type of the widget will be performed be the overridden method setWidget(IsWidget).
        Overrides:
        createWidget in class Component
        Parameters:
        rStyle - The component style
        Returns:
        The new widget
        See Also:
        Component.createWidget(StyleData)

      • getContainerWidget

        protected final com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.HasWidgets getContainerWidget()
        Returns the container widget of this instance.
        Returns:
        The container widget
